title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2186.11 - Project close-out
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2186.11 - Project close-out

State Regulations
(a) Project close-out. Project close-out will occur when all costs to be paid with
grant funds have been incurred, when the last progress report has been
submitted and no later than six months after the date for completion set forth
in the grant agreement with the respective grantee, or at such other time as
the agency may establish. At such time, the grantee must submit, in accordance
with the agency's requirements, documentation of its grant disbursements and
records, a certification of completion and final cost. Any cash advanced in
excess of the final cost must be refunded to the agency. (b) Monitoring and submitting performance
reports. Nothing in this or any other section will relieve the grantee of
whatever continuing responsibility may remain to monitor and submit performance
reports, even though project close-out has taken place. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
2186.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
